title: The basics of Music
description: Introduces the three fundamental elements of music: melody, harmony, and rhythm. These elements form the foundation of any musical composition
content: Music consists of 3 main elements: melody, harmony, and rhythm

flashcards.definition: A sequence of notes that form a tune
The combination of different notes played together
The pattern of beats and timing in music

quiz.question: Which element of music refers to the sequence of notes that create a tune?

title: Musical notes and pitch
description: Explains how music is built on notes and theur frequencies, focusing on the twelve note system and concept of octaves
content: Music is built on notes with specific frequencies. The western system has 12 notes

flashcards.definition: A musical sound with a specific pitch
The same note played higher or lower in pitch
The percieve frequency of a note

quiz.question: Which of the following is NOT a note in the western music system?

title: Scales and keys
description: Covers major and minor scales, how they create different moods in music, and how keys determine the set of notes used in a song
content: A scale is a set of notes in order. Major scales sound happy, minor scales sound sad

flashcards.definition: A sequence of notes played in order
The set of notes used in a song
A scale that sounds bright or happy

title: Chords and Harmony
description: Introduces chords, including major and minor chords, and explains how harmony is created through cord progressions
content: Chords are combinations of three or more notes played together, forming the basis of harmony in music

flashcards.definition: Multiple notes played together
A chord that sounds bright and happy
A repeating pattern of chords

title: Rhythm and time signatures
description: Teaches the role of beats, tempo, and time signatures in structuring music, with examples of common time signatures like 4/4 and 3/4
content: Rhythm is the timing of music, defined by beats and time signatures

flashcards.definition: The speed at which a piece of music is played
The basic unit of time in music
Defines the number of beats in each measure

quiz.question: Which time signature is known as common time?

title: Dynamic and Expression
description: Explores how volume and articulation affect music, introducing terms like 'forte' (loud) and 'piano' (soft), as well as crescendo and decrescendo
content: Dynamics indicate the loudness or softness of music

flashcards.definition: Play loudly
Play softly
Gradually increase in volume

quiz.question: What does piano mean in musical dynamics?

title: Musical instruments
description: Categorizes instruments into strings, wind, and percussion, explaining how each produces sound
content: Musical instruments are categorized by how they produce sound

flashcards.definition: Produce sound by vibrating strings
Produce sound by air passing through reeds or tubes
Instuments that create sound through striking or shaking

quiz.question: Which instrument belongs to the string family?
